```{r message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, include=FALSE, paged.print=FALSE}
library(shiny)
library(bayesrules)  # for the plotting functions
library(ggplot2)
```


```{r include=FALSE}
ui <- fluidPage(
  titlePanel("Probability of Contracting COVID-19"),
  
  sidebarLayout(
    sidebarPanel(
      sliderInput(inputId = "s1",
                   label = "P(S1 | C)",
                   # this is the default value for S1
                   value = 0.7,
                   min = 0,
                   max = 1,
                   step = 0.05),
      
      sliderInput(inputId = "s2", 
                 label = "P(S2 | C)",
                 value = 0.3, 
                 min = 0,
                 max = 1,
                 step = 0.05),
      
      sliderInput(inputId = "s3", 
                 label = "P(S3 | C)",
                 value = 0.5, 
                 min = 0,
                 max = 1,
                 step = 0.05)
    ),
    
    mainPanel(
      h4("Result"),
      tableOutput("priorTable"),
      h4(textOutput("result", container = span))
    )
  ) 
)
```

```{r include=FALSE}
server <- function(input, output) {

  output$view <- renderText({
    input$s1    
  })
  
  output$priorTable <- renderTable({
    df <- data.frame(S1 = c(input$s1),
                   S2 = c(input$s2),
                   S3 = c(input$s3))
    
    df
  })
  
  output$result <- renderText({
    covid <- input$s1 * input$s2 * input$s3 * 0.002
    covid
  })
}
```

```{r echo=FALSE}
shinyApp(ui = ui, server = server)
```
